page.title: 13Trade in Newton and Linton
page.content: The north of the area is well served by two shops in Linton and one in Newton-on-Ouse.One Linton shop incorporates a Post Office.The other sells newspapers,delivering twice daily to both villages,and fish and chips from a building at the rear. Mobile shops,an asset to the area,sell fruit,vegetables,meat,fish, bread and cakes.A video library and a fish and chip van visit once a week. In Newton there is a filling and service station,a tree nursery and a plant nursery,with a small market garden selling soft fruit and flowers in Linton-on-Ouse. Many people make regular visits to York and other neighbouring towns to buy food at supermarkets.No shops exist in Widdington,the nearest being in Nun Monkton,two miles distant,from where newspapers are collected.
